conclusion: To determine the heat exchange Q in the cyclic process, analyze each segment and apply the first law of thermodynamics.
First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
Identify process types: A to B is isothermal expansion, B to C is isobaric compression, C to D is isothermal compression, D to A is isobaric expansion.
Determine work done A to B: W_AB = nRT ln(V_B/V_A).
Determine work done B to C: W_BC = P (V_B - V_C).
Determine work done C to D: W_CD = nRT ln(V_C/V_D).
Determine work done D to A: W_DA = P (V_D - V_A).
Calculate net work done: Net work is area of rectangle formed by B→C and D→A.
Net work calculation: W_net = P × (V_B - V_C) = 25 J.
Change in internal energy ΔU for cyclic process is zero.
Calculate heat exchange Q: ΔU_cycle = Q_cycle - W_net, so Q_cycle = 25 J.
Final answer: Heat exchange Q is 25 J.
